data.title: Murshidabad violence: Over 150 arrested, internet suspended; CM Mamata Banerjee calls meeting
data.description: Following unrest in Murshidabad, West Bengal, triggered by the amended Waqf law, authorities have arrested over 150 individuals and deployed BSF forces to restore peace
data.content: Following unrest in Murshidabad, West Bengal, triggered by the amended Waqf law, authorities have arrested over 150 individuals and deployed BSF forces to restore peace. The Calcutta HC mandated the deployment after violence erupted, resulting in three deaths and widespread unrest across several districts. Political tensions escalate as BJP criticises Mamata Banerjee's government.

data.title: NIA probes Dawood link in 26/11 plot through Tahawwur Rana interrogation
data.description: The NIA is intensifying its investigation into Tahawwur Rana's role in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, scrutinizing his connections to a Dubai-based individual potentially linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company
data.content: The NIA is intensifying its investigation into Tahawwur Rana's role in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, scrutinizing his connections to a Dubai-based individual potentially linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company. Investigators are analysing phone calls between Rana and Headley, exploring possible ISI and LeT ties, and examining Rana's pre-attack visits to India.

Ukraine says Russian strike hit Indian pharma firm Kusum healthcare's warehouse: What we know so far
data.description: A Russian missile struck a warehouse belonging to Kusum Healthcare, an Indian pharmaceutical company, in Ukraine, prompting condemnation from the Ukrainian embassy, which alleged a deliberate targeting of Indian business...
data.content: A Russian missile struck a warehouse belonging to Kusum Healthcare, an Indian pharmaceutical company, in Ukraine, prompting condemnation from the Ukrainian embassy, which alleged a deliberate targeting of Indian businesses. While details on damage and casualties remain scarce, the incident has yet to elicit comment from the Indian or Russian governments.

Karnataka caste census recommends raising Backward Class reservations to 51%
data.description: Karnataka's caste census report suggests raising reservations for Backward Communities from 32% to 51%, as they constitute nearly 70% of the state's population
data.content: Karnataka's caste census report suggests raising reservations for Backward Communities from 32% to 51%, as they constitute nearly 70% of the state's population. The proposal includes extending this reservation to educational institutions, drawing parallels with Tamil Nadu and Jharkhand's higher reservation percentages. The survey, initiated in 2015 and completed in February 2024, places the OBC population at over 4.16 crore.
